title: Bossington Hill Walking Route

images.title: Arjen Bax / Footpath around Bossington Hill
images.caption: Two walkers on the footpath around Bossington Hill. This is the higher of two footpaths stuck to the West slope of the hill. Not fit for acrophobics! The lowest bump in the middle of the photo is Hurlstone Point in SS8949. At the horizon South Wales is faintly visible.

images.title: Phil Champion / Cairn on Bossington Hill
images.caption: This cairn is in a prominent possition on the hill overlooking Porlock Bay.

images.title: Martin Bodman / Selworthy: Porlock Bay
images.caption: Selworthy, Porlock Bay. View from the hill.

images.title: Guy Wareham / Hurlstone Combe
images.caption: Hurlstone Combe. Looking up the steep climb to the hill.

images.title: Bossington : Bossington Lane by Lewis Clarke, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bossington Lane. A view of the pretty village in spring. There's thatched cottages and cobbled paths under the care of the National Trust here.

description: Enjoy fabulous views of the Exmoor coastline on this bracing climb near Porlock. The area also includes attractive flora including bell heather, ling heather and western gorse. Look out for wildlife including buzzards, peregrine falcons, kestrels. The walk starts from the car park at the end of Hill Road, just east of the village of Bossington. You then head north along public footpaths before picking up a section of the South West Coast Path to take you towards the hill summit. From here there are lovely views over the Bristol Channel to the Welsh coast. An alternative route is to follow the coast path from the village of Bossington to Hurlstone Point. Then turn south to reach the hill. You can easily extend the walk by exploring the Holnicote Estate and climbing to Selworthy Beacon. The beacon is located just to the east of Bossington Hill. Also nearby are the settlements of Porlock and Porlock Weir . Porlock Weir is particularly lovely, with 17th century cottages and a delightful harbour.
